com.facebook.buck.event.listener

Class AmortizedShareComputation<T extends BuckEvent>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.event.listener.AmortizedShareComputation<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class AmortizedShareComputation<T extends BuckEvent>
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    Helper function for computing how much time each synchronous event took, amortized by the number of threads that were active at that time.

    For example, if our trace looked like 

     |---Parse (3) ---|
                  |--Compile1 (3) --|
                  |--Compile2 (3) --|
                  |--Compile3 (3) --|
                                    |--Package (3)--|

    This would return 

     { Parse: {amortized: 3, total: 3},
   Compile1: {amortized: 1, total: 3},
   Compile2: {amortized: 1, total: 3},
   Compile3: {amortized: 1, total: 3},
   Package: {amortized: 3, total: 3}}

    • Method Detail

      • addEvent

        public void addEvent(T event)
        For each event start/finished pair, we're going to amortize the amount of time that event took by the amount of events that were active during its duration. To achieve this, we walk through each event and split up the amount of time that has passed since the last event among all of the still active events. An event is considered to be still active if its started event fired but its finished event has not yet fired.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to be processed. events is required to be sorted by nanotime in ascending order, and two events on the same thread may not overlap.

      • close

        public void close()
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
